title: Exothermic rxn of HCl and NH3

content.description: <math alttext="H C l aqueous plus N H 3 aqueous react to produce N H 4 with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The chemical reaction between <math alttext="H C l aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N H 3 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented above. A student combines equimolar amounts of <math alttext="H C l aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N H 3 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, both solutions initially at <math alttext="24 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, in a coffee-cup calorimeter. The student observes that the mixture reaches a temperature of <math alttext="28 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the experimental results, which of the following can be concluded about the reaction?

choices.label: It is an endothermic process, because energy is released by the reaction and is gained by the reaction mixture.
It is an endothermic process, because energy is absorbed by the reaction and is lost from the reaction mixture.
It is an exothermic process, because energy is released by the reaction and is gained by the reaction mixture.
It is an exothermic process, because energy is absorbed by the reaction and is lost from the reaction mixture.

content.answer: It is an exothermic process, because energy is released by the reaction and is gained by the reaction mixture.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
